variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterControlRouterIndex

description: createRouter (101):
sheL3ctrlControlName
sheL3ctrlControlRpTrigger
-> sheL3IpRouterCreated
-> sheL3IpRouterControlResult
deleteRouter (102):
sheL3IpRouterControlRouterIndex
-> sheL3IpRouterDeleted
-> sheL3IpRouterControlResult
modifyRouter (103):
sheL3IpRouterControlRouterIndex
sheL3ctrlControlRpTrigger
-> sheL3IpRouterModified
-> sheL3IpRouterControlResult
enableManagementVr (104):
-> sheL3IpManagementVrEnabled
-> sheL3IpRouterControlResult
The command can only be applied if the sheL3ctrlManagementVrStatus is disabled.
The command is needed to upgrade an IPD release from L2 to L3 functionality.
To take effect the NE must reboot.
NOTE:
R4.0M/R4.7M will not support any router commands.
There is one default router available which could not be modified.

description: The Name of the Virtual Router.
Router names are unique and that NE rejects router creation
commands if a router name is already used by an existing router.
Router names of existing routers must not be modified.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterName

description: This object represents Routing Protocol (RP)
Triggers on a Virtual Router and it meant to
be used to initiate or shutdown routing
protocols on a VR. Multiple RPs can be acted
on simultaneously. Also, individual RPs can
be brought up in steps, which should not
affect the RPs that were running. The BITS
represent an Action-code that specifies what
action is to be performed for the RPs.
The actions are: initiate(1) or shutdown(0).
Bits 0-3 may be specified in any combination.
Individual routing protocols may be enabled
and disabled independently. Protocols are
enabled by setting the respective BIT and are
disabled by resetting the BIT.
So, for example, to enable RIP and BGP protocols
the RpTrigger bits 0 and 2 need to be set, and
as encoded as 10100000.
All zeros should be interpreted as all protocols
disable.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterRpTrigger

disable.

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortControlTimeStamp

description: Instance of the router port.
All l3RouterPort interfaces should use ifType = bridge(209) in the ifTable!
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortControlIfIndex

description: The MAC address of this router port.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortMacAddress

description: numbered(0)
unnumbered(1)
IP unnumbered only makes sense for point-to-point links between routers.
An unnumbered interface has no unique IP address assignment.
The address of the interface is 'borrowed' from one of the router's other
functional interfaces and used as the source address for routing updates
and packets sourced from the interface.
When IP unnumbered is configured, routes learned through the IP unnumbered
interface have the interface as the next hop instead of the source address
of the routing update.
In this way, address space is conserved.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortUnnumbered

description: The type of the sheL3IpRouterPortIpAddress, as defined in the InetAddress MIB.
Only address type ipv4(1) may appear in an actual router port table and is allowed
as value of this object for IP interfaces with valid address.
Unnumbered interfaces (no valid ip address needed) will use address type unknown(0).
NOTE
This object is deprecated. Definitions of IP addresses for router ports are to
be replaced by entries in the sheL3IpAddressTable.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: deprecated.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpAddressType

description: The IP address of this router port.
The type of this address is determined by the value of the sheL3IpRouterPortIpAddressType.
For loopback interfaces the IP address is read only.
NOTE
This object is deprecated. Definitions of IP addresses for router ports are to
be replaced by entries in the sheL3IpAddressTable.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: deprecated.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpAddress

description: Indicates the number of leading one bits that form the
mask to be logical-ANDed with the address.
NOTE
This object is deprecated. Definitions of IP addresses for router ports are to
be replaced by entries in the sheL3IpAddressTable.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: deprecated.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpPfxLen

description: This attribute points to an entry of the sheVlanTable.
This is the default VLAN ID of the router port used for frames sent by the router.
The value 0 is used if no VLAN is assigned to the port (automatically created loopback
and management interfaces).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortVlanId

description: This attribute points to an entry of the sheL3IpRouterTable.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortNetworkPointer

description: Used to identify outband and inband management interfaces.
Outband interfaces will additionaly use the PortType = mgmt(4)
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortManagementIf

description: Indicate the type of RouterPort:
br(1)
numbered interfaces
create / delete / modify by operator (with IP address and VLAN)
used for physical uplink interfaces and host IP services on CXU e.g. ANCP (up to 4095)
loop(2)
numbered interfaces
autocreated on create of routers (fixed IP address 127.0.0.1 and no VLAN)
one interface per router (up to 6)
mgmt(3)
numbered interfaces
one interface autocreated on startup (create of management router)
or create / delete / modify by operator (with IP address and VLAN)
used for management access (SNMP) to NE
l2vpn(4)
unnumbered interfaces (default association is loop interface)
create / delete / modify by operator (with VLAN)
used for VPLS/VPWS services at subscriber ports
hostL2vpn(5)
numbered interfaces
create / delete / modify by operator (with IP address and VLAN)
used for VPLS/VPWS services at host IP services on CXU as well as subscriber ports
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortType

description: This is the inner VLAN ID tag of the router port used for frames sent by the router
if the NE run in double tagging mode.
Set to 0 if no inner VLAN should be used or if the NE uses single tag mode.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortInnerVlanId

description: The used .1p priority for default VLAN.
Setting is don't care if no default VLAN should be used.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortVlanPriority

description: The used .1p priority for inner VLAN.
Setting is don't care if no inner VLAN should be used.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortInnerVlanPriority

description: Content will be used NE internaly.
Note:
Configurable with R4.7M.
A descriptive text for this router port for operator own notes.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortDescription

description: Could only be set on RouterPorts of type 'br' as long as the IPD should work as LER(label edge router).
If set true, this RouterPort is available for label switching and the content of the parameters
EnableLdp and LabelSpace become valid.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortLabelSwitching

description: Define the labelSpace binding to an ldp entity for a RouterPorts of type 'br' if LabelSwitching
is enabled for this port.
NOTE:
R4.0M/R4.7M will only support the default per platform labelspace 0.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortLabelSpace

description: Sets the default value for locally supported static MTU size for this IP Router Port.
NOTE:
RouterPort interfaces of type 'loop' (loopback interfaces) support a default MTU size of 16436 byte.
The MTU size for interfaces of type 'loop' and 'mgmt' could not be modified.
The configurable range for other interface types is restricted!
The MTU size for interfaces of type 'l2vpn' and 'hostl2vpn' could only be modified
if the interface is not assigned to an Vpn instance via sheVpnAcTable (sheL2VPNMib).
If the routerPort should be assigned to an Vpn instance of type 'VPLS', the configured
MTU size here must be equal to the MTU size on the Vpn instance.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortMtuSize

description: Status information if service filtering is enabled on this interface or not.
If 'true', only services configured via sheL3IpRouterPortAllowedServicesList could be used on this interface.
All other services will be blocked.
If 'false', no service filtering will be performed on this interface and all known services are allowed to run.
New parameter with R4.7M.
NOTE:
During release upgrade existing interfaces will use default value 'false' for service filtering for
backward compatibility reasons.
New created interfaces should use default setting 'true' for security reasons. To run services
on these interfaces, the filtering must be switched off or allowed services must be configured in
sheL3IpRouterPortAllowedServicesList.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortServiceFilteringEnabled

description: This list contain valid indeces of the sheL3IpRouterPortServiceTable for allowed services
on this interface. Each index consists of 1 octet.
Known services from sheL3IpRouterPortServiceTable which are not listed here, could not be used
via this interface in case of enabled service filtering.
The setting here is only valid, if sheL3IpRouterPortServiceFilteringEnabled = 'true', otherwise
it will be ignored.
New parameter with R4.7M.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortAllowedServicesList

description: sheL3IpRouterPortTable entry deleted

event.Summary: L3 IP router port table entry deleted

description: Instance of the router port.
All l3RouterPort interfaces should use ifType = bridge(209) in the ifTable!

SR5.1: deprecated; to be replaced by entries in the sheL3IpAddressTable.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortControlSecondaryIpAddress

description: Indicates the number of leading one bits that form the
mask to be logical-ANDed with the address.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: deprecated; to be replaced by entries in the sheL3IpAddressTable.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortControlSecondaryIpPfxLen

description: sheL3IpRouterPortTable entry modified
New with R4.7M.

Summary.eval: ($v2==1) ? 'Port service filtering enabled' : 'Port service filtering disabled'

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortControlTimeStamp

description: Status information if service filtering is enabled on this interface or not.
If 'true', only services configured via sheL3IpRouterPortAllowedServicesList could be used on this interface.
All other services will be blocked.
If 'false', no service filtering will be performed on this interface and all known services are allowed to run.
New parameter with R4.7M.
NOTE:
During release upgrade existing interfaces will use default value 'false' for service filtering for
backward compatibility reasons.
New created interfaces should use default setting 'true' for security reasons. To run services
on these interfaces, the filtering must be switched off or allowed services must be configured in
sheL3IpRouterPortAllowedServicesList.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortServiceFilteringEnabled

description: This list contain valid indeces of the sheL3IpRouterPortServiceTable for allowed services
on this interface. Each index consists of 1 octet.
Known services from sheL3IpRouterPortServiceTable which are not listed here, could not be used
via this interface in case of enabled service filtering.
The setting here is only valid, if sheL3IpRouterPortServiceFilteringEnabled = 'true', otherwise
it will be ignored.
New parameter with R4.7M.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortAllowedServicesList

description: Indicates that sheL3IpRouterPortDisabledMessages has been modified.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.

Summary.eval: ($v2==0) ? 'No messages are disabled on port' : 'Messages from filter profile table disabled on port'

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortControlTimeStamp

description: Configures a Message Filtering Profile to be used to select
messages to be disabled for this IP router port.
VALUES
0 - No messages to be explicitly disabled for this
router port (default).
NOTE: Some messages may nevertheless be disabled by
the NE globally as a general policy.
1..16 - Messages, as defined by the entry in the
sheL3CtrlMessageFilteringProfileTable identified
with the index equal to this value, are to be disabled
for this router port
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortDisabledMessages

description: Event notification that an entry in the sheL3IpRouterPortIpv4InterfaceTable has been modified.
The indication of whether IPv4 is enabled (up) or disabled
(down) on this interface. This object does not affect the
state of the interface itself, only its connection to an
IPv4 stack. The IF-MIB should be used to control the state
of the interface.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv4InterfaceEnableStatus

description: Sets the locally supported static MTU size for this speicific protocol.
Values:
0 - Use default setting given by sheL3IpRouterPortMtuSize (Default).
NOTE: NE cannot currently support separate MTU sizes for IPv4 and IPv6
-> only value 0 allowed.
NOTES:
- RouterPort interfaces of type 'loop' (loopback interfaces) support a default MTU size
of 16436 byte.
- The MTU size for interfaces of type 'loop' and 'mgmt' cannot be modified.
- The configurable range for other interface types is also restricted.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv4InterfaceMtuSize

description: Set DHCP usage for this IP Router Port IPv4 interface.
Values:
noUseDhcp(0) - DHCP will not be used and the IP Address has to be configured (default)
useDhcp(1) - use DHCP to obtain an IPv4 address
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv4InterfaceUseDhcp

description: Sets whether DHCPv4 is to be used on this IP Router Port IPv4 Interface to determine
the default router address from the DHCPv4 router option 3.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv4InterfaceUseDhcpDefaultRouter

description: Event notification that an entry in the sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceTable has been modified.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceModified SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceEnableStatus i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceMtuSize u 9999 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseDhcp i 0 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseDAD i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseAutoconfAddr i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseAutoconfDefaultRouter i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseAutoconfMtuSize i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceMldVersion i 1

$SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceModified SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceEnableStatus i 2 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceMtuSize u 9999 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseDhcp i 0 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseDAD i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseAutoconfAddr i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseAutoconfDefaultRouter i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseAutoconfMtuSize i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceMldVersion i 1

description: The indication of whether IPv6 is enabled (up) or disabled
(down) on this interface. This object does not affect the
state of the interface itself, only its connection to an
IPv6 stack. The IF-MIB should be used to control the state
of the interface.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceEnableStatus

description: Sets the locally supported static MTU size for this specific protocol.
Values:
0 - Use default setting given by sheL3IpRouterPortMtuSize (Default).
NOTE: NE cannot currently support separate MTU sizes for IPv4 and IPv6
-> only value 0 allowed.
NOTES:
- RouterPort interfaces of type 'loop' (loopback interfaces) support a default MTU size
of 16436 byte.
- The MTU size for interfaces of type 'loop' and 'mgmt' cannot be modified.
- The configurable range for other interface types is also restricted.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceMtuSize

description: Set DHCP usage for this IP Router Port IPv6 interface.
Values:
noUseDhcp(0) - DHCP will not be used and the IP Address has to be configured (default)
useDhcp(1) - use DHCPv6 to obtain an IPv6 address
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseDhcp

description: Sets whether Duplicate Address Detection (DAD) is to be used on this
IP Router Port IPv6 Interface.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseDAD

description: Sets whether Stateless Address Auto Configuration (SLAAC) is to be
used on this IP Router Port IPv6 Interface to generate IPv6 address
from the IPv6 prefix received in the router advertisment.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseAutoconfAddr

description: Sets whether Stateless Address Auto Configuration (SLAAC) is to be
used on this IP Router Port IPv6 Interface to determine the default
router address from the router advertisment.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseAutoconfDefaultRouter

description: Sets whether Stateless Address Auto Configuration (SLAAC) is to be
used on this IP Router Port IPv6 Interface to determine the MTU
size dynamically the router advertisment.
NOTE:
NE cannot currently support separate MTU sizes for IPv4 and IPv6
-> only false(2) allowed.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceUseAutoconfMtuSize

description: Sets whether Multicast Group Subscription is to use Version 1
(mldv1(1)) or Version 2 (mldv2(2)) of Multicast Listener Discovery
on this IP Router Port IPv6 Interface.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouterPortIpv6InterfaceMldVersion

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlTimeStamp

description: The sheL3IpRouterEntry this sheL3IpRouteEntry belongs to.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlRouterPointer

description: The type of the sheL3IpRouteDest address, as defined
in the InetAddress MIB.
Only address type ipv4(1) may appear in an actual
routing table and is allowed as value of this object.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlDestType

description: The destination IP address of this route.
The type of this address is determined by the value of
the sheL3IpRouteDestType object.
The values for the index objects sheL3IpRouteDest and
sheL3IpRoutePfxLen must be consistent. When the value
of sheL3IpRouteDest (excluding the zone index, if one
is present) is x, then the bitwise logical-AND
of x with the value of the mask formed from the
corresponding index object sheL3IpRoutePfxLen MUST be
equal to x.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlDest

description: Indicates the number of leading one bits that form the
mask to be logical-ANDed with the destination address
before being compared to the value in the
sheL3IpRouteDest field.
The values for the index objects sheL3IpRouteDest and
sheL3IpRoutePfxLen must be consistent. When the value
of sheL3IpRouteDest (excluding the zone index, if one
is present) is x, then the bitwise logical-AND
of x with the value of the mask formed from the
corresponding index object sheL3IpRoutePfxLen MUST be
equal to x.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlPfxLen

description: Administrative distance is the feature that routers use in order
to select the best path when there are two or more different
routes to the same destination from two different routing
protocols. Administrative distance defines the reliability of
a routing protocol. Each routing protocol is prioritized in order
of most to least reliable with the help of an administrative
distance value.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlDistance

description: The type of route. Note that local(3) refers to a
route for which the next hop is the final destination;
remote(4) refers to a route for which the next hop is
not the final destination.
Routes that do not result in traffic forwarding or
rejection should not be displayed, even if the
implementation keeps them stored internally.
reject(2) refers to a route that, if matched, discards
the message as unreachable and returns a notification
(e.g., ICMP error) to the message sender. This is used
in some protocols as a means of correctly aggregating
routes.
blackhole(5) refers to a route that, if matched
discards the message silently.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlType

description: The type of the sheL3IpRouteNextHop address, as
defined in the InetAddress MIB.
Value should be set to unknown(0) for non-remote
routes.
Only address type ipv4(1) may appear in an actual
routing table and is allowed for remote routes
as value of this object.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlNextHopType

description: On remote routes, the address of the next system on
route. For non-remote routes, a zero length string.
The type of this address is determined by the value of
the sheL3IpRouteNextHopType object.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlNextHop

description: The ifIndex value that identifies the local interface
(sheL3IpRouterPortEntry) through which the next hop
of this route should be reached. A value of 0 is valid
and represents the scenario where no interface is specified.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlInterfaceIndex

description: The primary routing metric for this route. The
semantics of this metric are determined by the routing
protocol specified in the route's sheL3IpRouteProto
value. If this metric is not used, its value should be
set to -1.
NOTE:
Support started with R4.7M.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlMetric1

description: An alternate routing metric for this route. The
semantics of this metric are determined by the routing-
protocol specified in the route's sheL3IpRouteProto
value.If this metric is not used, its value should be
set to -1.
NOTE:
Currently no support planed.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlMetric2

description: An alternate routing metric for this route. The
semantics of this metric are determined by the routing-
protocol specified in the route's sheL3IpRouteProto
value. If this metric is not used, its value should be
set to -1.
NOTE:
Currently no support planed.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlMetric3

description: An alternate routing metric for this route. The
semantics of this metric are determined by the routing-
protocol specified in the route's sheL3IpRouteProto
value. If this metric is not used, its value should be
set to -1.
NOTE:
Currently no support planed.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlMetric4

description: An alternate routing metric for this route. The
semantics of this metric are determined by the routing-
protocol specified in the route's sheL3IpRouteProto
value. If this metric is not used, its value should be
set to -1.
NOTE:
Currently no support planed.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpRouteControlMetric5

description: List name which identifies the access list unambiguously.
The list name is used by other managed objects to reference the access list used
by this object.
Spaces and other special characters (: ?) are not allowed!!
The ACL name should NOT start with a number.

Each RuleIndex should be written as decimal number separated by a semicolon, e.g.: '2;25;100'
The order of rules is meaningful because the switch stops checking the access list
after a match occurs.

The order of rules is meaningful because the switch stops checking the access list
after a match occurs.

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlAclControlTimeStamp

description: List name which identifies the access list to which the rule belongs unambiguously.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlAclRuleListName

description: The type of address, as defined in the InetAddress MIB.
Only address type ipv4(1) may appear in an actual release.
NOTE:
With R4.7M also type 'unknown(0)' could be used together with a addresslist or addressrange configuration.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlAclRuleAddrType

description: The IP address of this rule.
The type of this address is determined by the value of the sheL3CtrlAclRuleAddrType object.
0.0.0.0 if Action=denyAny or permitAny.
NOTE:
New with R4.7M and only together with AddrType = 'unknown(0)', the NE will accept a list of
single addresses and/or address ranges.
Single addresses must be separate with semicolon -> '192.168.1.1;192.168.2.1'
Address ranges must be connected with a dash -> '192.168.2.1-192.168.2.10'
A combination of both is also valid -> '192.168.1.1;192.168.2.1-192.168.2.10'
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlAclRuleAddr

description: Indicates the number of leading one bits that form the
mask to be logical-ANDed with the address.
0 if Action=denyAny or permitAny.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlAclRuleAddrPfxLen

description: Describes the action on rule match.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlAclRuleAction

description: Configuration event.
The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlAclControlTimeStamp

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressEntryCreated SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressControlTimeStamp u 9999 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressType i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressPrefix o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressOrigin i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressStatus i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressCreated t 31536000 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressLastChanged t 31536000

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressControlTimeStamp

description: The type of address. broadcast(3) is not a valid value for
IPv6 addresses (RFC 3513).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressType

description: A pointer to the row in the prefix table to which this
address belongs. May be { 0 0 } if there is no such row.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressPrefix

description: The origin of the address.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressOrigin

description: The status of the address, describing if the address can be
used for communication.
In the absence of other information, an IPv4 address is
always preferred(1).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressStatus

description: The value of sysUpTime at the time this entry was created.
If this entry was created prior to the last re-
initialization of the local network management subsystem
then this object contains a zero value.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressCreated

description: The value of sysUpTime at the time this entry was last
updated. If this entry was updated prior to the last re-
initialization of the local network management subsystem
then this object contains a zero value.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressLastChanged

description: Event notification that an entry in the sheL3IpAddressTable has been modified.
NOTE
Since entries within the sheL3IpAddressTable cannot be modified, this
notification is not supported by the NE.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressEntryModified SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressControlTimeStamp u 9999 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressType i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressPrefix o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressOrigin i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressStatus i 1 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressCreated t 31536000 SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressLastChanged t 31536000

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressControlTimeStamp

description: The type of address. broadcast(3) is not a valid value for
IPv6 addresses (RFC 3513).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressType

description: A pointer to the row in the prefix table to which this
address belongs. May be { 0 0 } if there is no such row.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressPrefix

description: The origin of the address.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressOrigin

description: The status of the address, describing if the address can be
used for communication.
In the absence of other information, an IPv4 address is
always preferred(1).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressStatus

description: The value of sysUpTime at the time this entry was created.
If this entry was created prior to the last re-
initialization of the local network management subsystem
then this object contains a zero value.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressCreated

description: The value of sysUpTime at the time this entry was last
updated. If this entry was updated prior to the last re-
initialization of the local network management subsystem
then this object contains a zero value.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressLastChanged

description: Event notification that an entry in the sheL3IpAddressTable has been deleted.
The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressControlTimeStamp

description: Used to set sheL3IpAddressAddrType.
NOTE:
The NE supports only the following adddress types in this table:
ipv4(1)
ipv6(2)
ipv6z(4) (for link-local addresses).
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressControlAddrType

description: Used to set sheL3IpAddressAddr.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3IpAddressControlAddr

description: Indicates that a new sheL3CtrlMessageFilteringProfileEntry
has been created.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.

event.Summary: New control message filtering profile $v2 entry created

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlMessageFilteringControlTimeStamp

description: Name of the profile.
Spaces and other special characters (: ?) are not allowed.
The name should not start with a number.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlMessageFilteringProfileName

description: Identifies the specific ICMPv4 messages to select when using this profile.
VALUES
destinationUnreachable(0) - ICMPv4 messsage type 3 (Destination Unreachable)
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlMessageFilteringProfileIcmpV4

description: Identifies the specific ICMPv6 messages to select when using this profile.
VALUES
destinationUnreachable(0) - ICMPv6 messsage type 1 (Destination Unreachable)
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlMessageFilteringProfileIcmpV6

description: Indicates that an existing sheL3CtrlMessageFilteringProfileEntry
has been modified.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.

event.Summary: New control message filtering profile entry modified

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlMessageFilteringControlTimeStamp

description: Identifies the specific ICMPv4 messages to select when using this profile.
VALUES
destinationUnreachable(0) - ICMPv4 messsage type 3 (Destination Unreachable)
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlMessageFilteringProfileIcmpV4

description: Identifies the specific ICMPv6 messages to select when using this profile.
VALUES
destinationUnreachable(0) - ICMPv6 messsage type 1 (Destination Unreachable)
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlMessageFilteringProfileIcmpV6

description: Indicates that an existing sheL3CtrlMessageFilteringProfileEntry
has been deleted.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.

event.Summary: New control message filtering profile entry deleted

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlMessageFilteringControlTimeStamp

description: Index identifying the entry in the sheL3CtrlMessageFilteringProfileTable
on which the control request is to apply.
VALUES
0 - createMessageFilterProfile(241) only:
Index of the new entry will be assigned by the NE.
modifyMessageFilterProfile(242),
deleteMessageFilterProfile(243):
Not valid.
1..16 - createMessageFilterProfile(241):
NE will create a new entry with this index;
NOTE: index must not be in use!
modifyMessageFilterProfile(242),
deleteMessageFilterProfile(243):
An entry must exist in the table identified by an
index with this value.
REVISION HISTORY
SR5.1: New.
variables.name: SHE-L3CTRL-MIB::sheL3CtrlMessageFilteringControlIndex
